00001 // =============================================================================
00002 // Name   : teleop_arm_dish.cpp
00003 // Author : Jonathan Hasenzahl
00004 // Date   : 2012
00005 //
00006 // Implements the ROS node "teleop_arm_dish". This node generates commands for
00007 // the "arm_control" node based on activity in the neuron dish.
00008 // =============================================================================
00009 
00010 #include "arm/teleop_arm_dish.h"
00011 #include "arm/cartesian_move.h"
00012 #include "arm/cartesian_moves.h"
00013 #include "arm/constant_move_time.h"
00014 #include "time_server/time_srv.h"
00015 #include "arm/movement_definitions.h"
00016 #include <cmath>

00018 #define MIDPOINT 4.5
00019 
00020 void TeleopArmDish::init()
00021 {
00022     // Get parameters
00023     getParams();
00024 
00025     // Initialize client and publisher
00026     //     Cartesian commands or constant move commands: for now you can use one
00027     //     or the other. Keep one commented out.
00028     //cmd_pub_ = n_.advertise<arm::cartesian_moves>("cartesian_moves", 1000);
00029     cmd_pub_ = n_.advertise<arm::constant_move_time>("constant_move_times", 1);
00030     time_client_ = n_.serviceClient<time_server::time_srv>("time_service");
00031 
00032     // Wait for subscriber
00033     ROS_INFO("Waiting for subscriber...");
00034     while (cmd_pub_.getNumSubscribers() < 1 && ros::ok());
00035 
00036     // Initialize subscriber
00037     cat_sub_ = n_.subscribe("cats", 1000, &TeleopArmDish::callback, this);
00038 
00039     // Run the node
00040     run();
00041 }
00042 
00043 void TeleopArmDish::getParams()
00044 {
00045     // Get ARM speed parameter
00046     if (!n_.getParam("arm_speed", speed_))
00047     {
00048         ROS_WARN("Could not load arm_speed parameter, default is 2");
00049         speed_ = 2;
00050     }
00051 
00052     // Get ARM safe range parameter
00053     if (!n_.getParam("arm_safe_range", arm_safe_range_))
00054     {
00055         ROS_WARN("Could not load arm_safe_range parameter, default is 20000.0");
00056         arm_safe_range_ = 20000.0;
00057     }
00058 
00059     // Get max range from midpoint parameter
00060     if (!n_.getParam("max_range_from_midpoint", max_range_from_midpoint_))
00061     {
00062         ROS_WARN("Could not load max_range_from_midpoint parameter, default is 1.0");
00063         max_range_from_midpoint_ = 1.0;
00064     }
00065 }
00066 
00067 void TeleopArmDish::run()
00068 {
00069     while(ros::ok())
00070     {
00071         ros::spinOnce();
00072         if (!queue_.empty())
00073         {
00074             // Use one or the other, keep only one uncommented
00075             //publishCartesianMove();
00076             publishConstantMove();
00077         }
00078     }
00079 }
00080 
00081 void TeleopArmDish::callback(const burst_calc::cat::ConstPtr& c)
00082 {
00083     queue_.push(*c);
00084 }
00085 
00086 void TeleopArmDish::publishCartesianMove()
00087 {
00088     burst_calc::cat cat = queue_.front();
00089     queue_.pop();
00090     time_server::time_srv cat_start;
00091     cat_start.request.target = cat.header.stamp;
00092 
00093     if (time_client_.call(cat_start))
00094     {
00095         printf("CAT start time : %f\n", cat.header.stamp.toSec());
00096         printf("Server time    : %f\n", cat_start.response.actual.toSec());
00097         printf("Delta          : %f\n", cat_start.response.delta.toSec());
00098 
00099         // The delta shouldn't be negative (server time is <= CAT time)
00100         if (cat_start.response.delta >= ros::Duration(0))
00101         {
00102             ROS_INFO("Sleeping for %.3fs", cat_start.response.delta.toSec());
00103             (cat_start.response.delta - ros::Duration(0.1)).sleep();
00104 
00105             //
00106             arm::cartesian_moves cmd;
00107             cmd.header.stamp = cat.header.stamp;
00108             cmd.end = cat.end;
00109             int size = cat.cas.size();
00110             for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
00111             {
00112                 arm::cartesian_move move;
00113                 move.header.stamp = cat.header.stamp;
00114 
00115                 // Currently all axes have the same speed
00116                 move.speeds.fill(static_cast<int8_t>(speed_));
00117 
00118                 // Right now only X/Y movement is implemented
00119                 move.positions[X] = getArmCoord(cat.cas[i].x);
00120                 move.positions[Y] = getArmCoord(cat.cas[i].y);
00121                 move.positions[Z] = ORIGIN_POSITION[Z];
00122                 move.positions[YAW] = ORIGIN_POSITION[YAW];
00123                 move.positions[PITCH] = ORIGIN_POSITION[PITCH];
00124                 move.positions[ROLL] = ORIGIN_POSITION[ROLL];
00125                 move.positions[GRIP] = ORIGIN_POSITION[GRIP];
00126 
00127                 //printf("CA  : x[%10.3f] y[%10.3f]\n", x, y);
00128                 //printf("ARM : x[%10.3f] y[%10.3f]\n", cmd.position[ARM_X], cmd.position[ARM_Y]);
00129 
00130                 // Some error checking so we don't exceed the bounds of the ARM
00131                 if (fabs(move.positions[X] > 20000))
00132                 {
00133                     ROS_ERROR("X-axis position (%f) out of bounds", move.positions[X]);
00134                     move.positions[X] = 0;
00135                 }
00136                 if (fabs(move.positions[Y] > 20000))
00137                 {
00138                     ROS_ERROR("Y-axis position (%f) out of bounds", move.positions[Y]);
00139                     move.positions[Y] = 0;
00140                 }
00141 
00142                 cmd.moves.push_back(move);
00143             }
00144 
00145             // Publish the move and wait for the duration of the burst
00146             cmd_pub_.publish(cmd);
00147             ROS_INFO("Command published, sleeping for %.3fs",
00148                      (cat.end - cat.header.stamp).toSec());
00149             (cat.end - cat.header.stamp).sleep();
00150 
00151             time_server::time_srv cat_end;
00152             cat_end.request.target = cat.end;
00153             time_client_.call(cat_end);
00154             printf("CAT end time : %f\n", cat.end.toSec());
00155             printf("Server time  : %f\n", cat_end.response.actual.toSec());
00156             printf("Delta        : %f\n", cat_end.response.delta.toSec());
00157         }
00158         else
00159             ROS_ERROR("CAT start time is behind server time, no command will be issued");
00160     }
00161     else
00162         ROS_ERROR("Time server is not responding, no command will be issued");
00163 }
00164 
00165 void TeleopArmDish::publishConstantMove()
00166 {
00167     burst_calc::cat cat = queue_.front();
00168     queue_.pop();
00169     time_server::time_srv cat_start;
00170     cat_start.request.target = cat.header.stamp;
00171 
00172     if (time_client_.call(cat_start))
00173     {
00174         /*printf("CAT start time : %f\n", cat.header.stamp.toSec());
00175         printf("Server time    : %f\n", cat_start.response.actual.toSec());
00176         printf("Delta          : %f\n", cat_start.response.delta.toSec());*/
00177 
00178         // The delta shouldn't be negative (server time is <= CAT time)
00179         if (cat_start.response.delta >= ros::Duration(0))
00180         {
00181             ROS_INFO("SLeeping for %.3fs before publishing command",
00182                      cat_start.response.delta.toSec());
00183             cat_start.response.delta.sleep();
00184 
00185             arm::constant_move_time cmd;
00186             cmd.header.stamp = cat.header.stamp;
00187             cmd.end = cat.end;
00188             int size = cat.cas.size();
00189             double x = 0.0;
00190             double y = 0.0;
00191 
00192             // Add all of the CA coordinates
00193             for (int i = 0; i < size; i++)
00194             {
00195                 x += cat.cas[i].x;
00196                 y += cat.cas[i].y;
00197             }
00198 
00199             // Get the average coordinates of the CAT
00200             x /= size;
00201             y /= size;
00202             printf("X: %.3f Y: %.3f\n", x, y);
00203 
00204             // Set the applicable movement states.
00205             // If coordinate < midpoint, movement is forward/left
00206             // If coordinate > midpoint is negative, movement is backward/right
00207             if (y - MIDPOINT < 0)
00208             {
00209                 ROS_INFO("Y is ABOVE the midpoint, moving FORWARD");
00210                 cmd.move.states[X] = ARM_FORWARD;
00211             }
00212             else
00213             {
00214                 ROS_INFO("Y is BELOW the midpoint, moving BACKWARD");
00215                 cmd.move.states[X] = ARM_BACKWARD;
00216             }
00217 
00218             if (x - MIDPOINT < 0)
00219             {
00220                 ROS_INFO("X is to the LEFT of the midpoint, moving LEFT");
00221                 cmd.move.states[Y] = ARM_LEFT;
00222             }
00223             else
00224             {
00225                 ROS_INFO("X is to the RIGHT of the midpoint, moving RIGHT");
00226                 cmd.move.states[Y] = ARM_RIGHT;
00227             }
00228 
00229 
00230             // Currently all axes have the same speed
00231             cmd.move.speeds.fill(static_cast<int8_t>(speed_));
00232 
00233             // Everything else is 0 (doesn't move)
00234             cmd.move.states[Z] = 0;
00235             cmd.move.states[YAW] = 0;
00236             cmd.move.states[PITCH] = 0;
00237             cmd.move.states[ROLL] = 0;
00238             cmd.move.states[GRIP] = 0;
00239             cmd.move.states[LIFT] = 0;
00240 
00241             printf("[%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d]\n",
00242                    cmd.move.states[X], cmd.move.states[Y],
00243                    cmd.move.states[Z], cmd.move.states[YAW],
00244                    cmd.move.states[PITCH], cmd.move.states[ROLL],
00245                    cmd.move.states[GRIP], cmd.move.states[LIFT]);
00246             printf("[%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d] [%d]\n",
00247                    cmd.move.speeds[X], cmd.move.speeds[Y],
00248                    cmd.move.speeds[Z], cmd.move.speeds[YAW],
00249                    cmd.move.speeds[PITCH], cmd.move.speeds[ROLL],
00250                    cmd.move.speeds[GRIP]);
00251 
00252             // Publish the move and wait for the duration of the burst
00253             cmd_pub_.publish(cmd);
00254             ROS_INFO("Sleeping for duration of command (%.3fs)",
00255                      (cat.end - cat.header.stamp).toSec());
00256             (cat.end - cat.header.stamp).sleep();
00257 
00258             /*time_server::time_srv cat_end;
00259             cat_end.request.target = cat.end;
00260             time_client_.call(cat_end);
00261             printf("CAT end time : %f\n", cat.end.toSec());
00262             printf("Server time  : %f\n", cat_end.response.actual.toSec());
00263             printf("Delta        : %f\n", cat_end.response.delta.toSec());*/
00264         }
00265         else
00266         {
00267             ROS_ERROR("CAT start time (%.3f) is behind server time (%.3f): no command will be issued",
00268                       cat_start.request.target.toSec(), cat_start.response.actual.toSec());
00269         }
00270     }
00271     else
00272         ROS_ERROR("Time server is not responding: no command will be issued");
00273 }
00274 
00275 double TeleopArmDish::getArmCoord(double coord)
00276 {
00277     // arm_safe_range_:
00278     //     The safe range, in ARM units (AU), for the ARM to move in an X/Y
00279     //     square is -20000:20000 AU on each axis (40001 AU total). The actual
00280     //     safe range for each individual axis is -28000:28000, but that will
00281     //     shrink depending on the value of the other axis.
00282     //
00283     // max_range_from_midpoint_:
00284     //     Each axis of the CAT grid ranges from 1:8, with 1 in the upper left
00285     //     corner. The midpoint of each axis is 4.5 ([1+8]/2) CAT units (CU).
00286     //     The max is range is the farthest that the CAT strays from the
00287     //     midpoint in either direction on either axis.
00288     //
00289     // The returned value will always be within the ARM safe range as long as
00290     // each CA is within the max range we specified.
00291     return (coord - MIDPOINT) * -(arm_safe_range_ / max_range_from_midpoint_);
00292 }
00293 
00294 int main(int argc, char** argv)
00295 {
00296     ros::init(argc, argv, "teleop_arm_dish");
00297     TeleopArmDish teleop_arm_dish;
00298     return 0;
00299 }
